maml:description.maml:para: Adds a client computer to a target group.

The Add-WsusComputer cmdlet adds the specified computer to the specified target group on the local server or a specified server. You can invoke this command by using the pipeline operator for the results of the Get-WsusComputer cmdlet. Calling the Get-WsusComputer cmdlet and passing the results into this cmdlet enables you to leverage the filtering capabilities of the Get-WsusComputer cmdlet in moving the desired computers to the specified target group. The server used in the Get-WsusComputer cmdlet is also used in this cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the client computer to be added. This value is obtained by running the Get-WsusComputer cmdlet and piping the resulting WsusComputer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the computer target group for which to run this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the object that contains the client computer to be added. This value is obtained by running the Get-WsusComputer cmdlet and piping the resulting WsusComputer object into this cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the name of the computer target group for which to run this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add computers to a target group
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer -Name "contoso" | Get-WsusComputer -NameIncludes "winvm" | Add-WsusComputer -TargetGroupName "Windows Virtual Machines"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds all computers with winvm in the name to the target group named Windows Virtual Machines on the server named contoso.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a dynamic category to a WSUS server.
The Add-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet adds a dynamic category to a Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.
In order to transfer dynamic categories from one update server to another, pass the results of the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the WSUS server to which this cmdlet adds the dynamic category. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet adds the dynamic category to the local server.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category to add. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to add.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the WSUS server to which this cmdlet adds the dynamic category. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet adds the dynamic category to the local server.
Specifies the dynamic category object that this cmdlet adds to the server. To obtain a dynamic category, use the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category to add. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the dynamic category object that this cmdlet adds to the server. To obtain a dynamic category, use the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to add.

Specifies the WSUS server to which this cmdlet adds the dynamic category. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet adds the dynamic category to the local server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a dynamic category to the local WSUS server
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Add-WsusDynamicCategory -DynamicCategoryType Device -Name "PCI/Device07" Name Type Status ---- ---- ------ PCI/Device07 Device True

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a dynamic category named PCI/Device07 the local update server. The command specifies that they type is Device.

maml:description.maml:para: Approves an update to be applied to clients.
The Approve-WsusUpdate cmdlet approves an update to be applied to clients. This operation requires Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) Administrator privileges.
To use this cmdlet, run the Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet and pipe the resulting WsusUpdate object into this cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the action that clients should perform when applying the associated update. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Install -- Not Approved -- Uninstall
Specifies the name of the computer target group for which to run this cmdlet.

Specifies the object that contains the server of the update to be approved or denied as well as the update to be approved or denied. This value is obtained by running the Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet and passing the resulting WsusUpdate object into this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies the action that clients should perform when applying the associated update. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Install -- Not Approved -- Uninstall

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the name of the computer target group for which to run this cmdlet.

Specifies the object that contains the server of the update to be approved or denied as well as the update to be approved or denied. This value is obtained by running the Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet and passing the resulting WsusUpdate object into this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Approve updates
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusUpdate -Classification All -Approval Unapproved -Status FailedOrNeeded | Approve-WsusUpdate -Action Install -TargetGroupName "All Computers"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command approves for installation all unapproved updates with a status of failed or needed.

maml:description.maml:para: Declines the update for deployment.

The Deny-WsusUpdate cmdlet declines the specified cmdlet for deployment. To use this cmdlet, run the Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet and pass the resulting WsusUpdate object into this cmdlet. This operation requires Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) Administrator privileges.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the object that contains the server of the update to be approved or denied as well as the update to be approved or denied. This value is obtained by running the Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet and passing the resulting WsusUpdate object into this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the object that contains the server of the update to be approved or denied as well as the update to be approved or denied. This value is obtained by running the Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet and passing the resulting WsusUpdate object into this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Deny updates
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusUpdate -Classification All -Approval Unapproved -Status FailedOrNeeded | Deny-WsusUpdate

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command declines all unapproved updates with a status of failed or needed.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of all WSUS classifications currently available in the system.

The Get-WsusClassification cmdlet gets the list of all Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) classifications. You can filter this list using the Where-Object cmdlet with the results passed into the Set-WsusClassification cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get classifications
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer | Get-WsusClassification Title ID ----- -- Applications 5c9376ab-8ce6-464a-b136-22113dd69801 Critical Updates e6cf1350-c01b-414d-a61f-263d14d133b4 Definition Updates e0789628-ce08-4437-be74-2495b842f43b Drivers ebfc1fc5-71a4-4f7b-9aca-3b9a503104a0 Feature Packs b54e7d24-7add-428f-8b75-90a396fa584f Security Updates 0fa1201d-4330-4fa8-8ae9-b877473b6441 Service Packs 68c5b0a3-d1a6-4553-ae49-01d3a7827828 Tools b4832bd8-e735-4761-8daf-37f882276dab Update Rollups 28bc880e-0592-4cbf-8f95-c79b17911d5f Updates cd5ffd1e-e932-4e3a-bf74-18bf0b1bbd83

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all classifications.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get classifications that have a specified title
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer | Get-WsusClassification | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.Classification.Title -Eq "Drivers"} Title ID ----- -- Drivers ebfc1fc5-71a4-4f7b-9aca-3b9a503104a0

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the classification with a title of Drivers.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the WSUS computer object that represents the client computer.

The Get-WsusComputer cmdlet gets one or more Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) computers based on the specified filtering criteria such as operating system, computer name, update installation status, last reported status time, and etcetera.
If the Get-WsusServer cmdlet is run and the resulting IUpdateServer object is passed into this cmdlet, then the specified server will be used rather than the local server.
This cmdlet can be passed into the Add-WsusComputer cmdlet.
Specifies that all computers are to be returned. The information displayed includes the computer name, IP address, operating system, and last status report time.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies the list of target group to search.

Specifies the computer update state as represented in the WSUS Console user interface. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- FailedOrNeeded -- InstalledNotApplicableOrNoStatus -- Failed -- InstalledNotApplicable -- NoStatus -- Any

Specifies the installation states to exclude. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- All -- Downloaded -- Failed -- Installed -- InstalledPendingReboot -- NotApplicable -- NotInstalled -- Unknown
Specifies the earliest reported status time. This parameter can be used in combination with the ToLastReportedStatusTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.

Specifies the earliest last synchronization time for which to search. This parameter can be used in combination with the ToLastSynchTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.

Specifies the installation states to include. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- All -- Downloaded -- Failed -- Installed -- InstalledPendingReboot -- NotApplicable -- NotInstalled -- Unknown
Specifies that clients of a downstream server should be included, not clients of this server.
Specifies that the ComputerTargetGroups parameter should include descendant groups. This value has no impact if the ComputerTargetGroups parameter is not used.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the partial name of the computer for which to search.
Specifies the list of requested target group names for which to search.
Specifies the latest reported status time. This parameter can be used in combination with the FromLastReportedStatusTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.

Specifies the latest last synchronization time for which to search. This parameter can be used in combination with the FromLastSynchTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies that all computers are to be returned. The information displayed includes the computer name, IP address, operating system, and last status report time.
Specifies the list of target group to search.

Specifies the computer update state as represented in the WSUS Console user interface. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- FailedOrNeeded -- InstalledNotApplicableOrNoStatus -- Failed -- InstalledNotApplicable -- NoStatus -- Any

Specifies the installation states to exclude. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- All -- Downloaded -- Failed -- Installed -- InstalledPendingReboot -- NotApplicable -- NotInstalled -- Unknown
Specifies the earliest reported status time. This parameter can be used in combination with the ToLastReportedStatusTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.

Specifies the earliest last synchronization time for which to search. This parameter can be used in combination with the ToLastSynchTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.
Specifies that clients of a downstream server should be included, not clients of this server.
Specifies that the ComputerTargetGroups parameter should include descendant groups. This value has no impact if the ComputerTargetGroups parameter is not used.

Specifies the installation states to include. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- All -- Downloaded -- Failed -- Installed -- InstalledPendingReboot -- NotApplicable -- NotInstalled -- Unknown

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the partial name of the computer for which to search.
Specifies the list of requested target group names for which to search.
Specifies the latest reported status time. This parameter can be used in combination with the FromLastReportedStatusTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.

Specifies the latest last synchronization time for which to search. This parameter can be used in combination with the FromLastSynchTime parameter in order to create a date range to use in the search.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all client computers
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusComputer -All Computer IP Address Operating System Last Status Report -------- ---------- ---------------- ------------------ contoso XXXX:XXXX:XX:X:XXXX:XXX:XXXX: Windows Server 2008 6/2/2010 12:00:00 AM XXXX Enterprise Edition (full installation)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all client computers.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get client computers that have names that contain a string
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusComputer -NameIncludes "contoso" Computer IP Address Operating System Last Status Report -------- ---------- ---------------- ------------------ contoso XXXX:XXXX:XX:X:XXXX:XXX:XXXX: Windows Server 2008 6/2/2010 12:00:00 AM XXXX Enterprise Edition (full installation)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the client computer whose name includes contoso.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get client computers by specifying dates
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusComputer -FromLastReportedStatusTime 6/1/10 -ToLastReportedStatusTime 6/30/10 Computer IP Address Operating System Last Status Report -------- ---------- ---------------- ------------------ contoso XXXX:XXXX:XX:X:XXXX:XXX:XXXX: Windows Server 2008 6/2/2010 12:00:00 AM XXXX Enterprise Edition (full installation)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all client computers with a last reported status date and time between June 1, 2010 and June 30, 2010.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets dynamic categories on a WSUS server.
The Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet gets dynamic categories on a Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet gets dynamic categories on the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet gets dynamic category from the local server.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to get.
Specifies the type of the dynamic categories that this cmdlet gets. The possible values are the same as those of the DynamicCategoryType parameter.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet gets dynamic categories on the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet gets dynamic category from the local server.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application
Specifies the type of the dynamic categories that this cmdlet gets. The possible values are the same as those of the DynamicCategoryType parameter.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to get.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet gets dynamic categories on the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet gets dynamic category from the local server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all dynamic categories for specified servers
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-WsusServer | Get-WsusDynamicCategory Name Type Status ---- ---- ------ 5d6a452a-55ba-4e11-adac-85e180bda3d6 ComputerModel True PCI/Device07 Device True

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all dynamic categories from the current update server by using the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. The command passes the server to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. The current cmdlet gets the available dynamic categories for the update server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a named dynamic category
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-WsusDynamicCategory -DynamicCategoryType Device -Name "PCI/Device07" Name Type Status ---- ---- ------ PCI/Device07 Device True

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the dynamic category named PCI/Device07 that is a Device type.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get dynamic categories by type
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-WsusDynamicCategory -DynamicCategoryTypeFilter ComputerModel Name Type Status ---- ---- ------ 5d6a452a-55ba-4e11-adac-85e180bda3d6 ComputerModel True

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets dynamic categories of the type ComputerModel that are currently available on the local server.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of all products currently available on WSUS.

The Get-WsusProduct cmdlet gets the list of all Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) products (categories). This list can be filtered using the Where-Object cmdlet with the results passed into the Set-WsusProduct cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the partial title of the product for which to search.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the partial title of the product for which to search.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all products for a WSUS server
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusProduct Title ID ----- -- Antigen for Exchange/SMTP 5d6a452a-55ba-4e11-adac-85e180bda3d6 Antigen 116a3557-3847-4858-9f03-38e94b977456

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all products defined by the WSUS server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get products by title
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusProduct | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.product.title -eq "Antigen"} Title ID ----- -- Antigen 116a3557-3847-4858-9f03-38e94b977456

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all products where the product title is equal to Antigen.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get products by partial title
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusProduct | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.product.title -match "Office"} Title ID ----- -- Office 2002/XP 6248b8b1-ffeb-dbd9-887a-2acf53b09dfe Office 2003 1403f223-a63f-f572-82ba-c92391218055 Office 2007 041e4f9f-3a3d-4f58-8b2f-5e6fe95c4591 Office 2010 84f5f325-30d7-41c4-81d1-87a0e6535b66 Office Communications Server 2007 R2 22bf57a8-4fe1-425f-bdaa-32b4f655284b Office Communications Server 2007 e164fc3d-96be-4811-8ad5-ebe692be33dd Office Communications Server And Office Communicator 504ae250-57c5-484a-8a10-a2c35ea0689b Office Communicator 2007 R2 8bc19572-a4b6-4910-b70d-716fecffc1eb Office 477b856e-65c4-4473-b621-a8b230bb70d9 Visual Studio 2010 Tools for Office Runtime cbfd1e71-9d9e-457e-a8c5-500c47cfe9f3

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all products where the product title contains the word Office.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the WSUS update server object.

The Get-WsusServer cmdlet gets the Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) update server object. This cmdlet requires the server name, port number and a flag that specifies if the server uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) as parameters.
Given a server name, port number, and flag specifying whether to use SSL, returns an IUpdateServer object.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the name of a WSUS server.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies that the WSUS server should use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) via HTTPS to communicate with an upstream server.
Specifies the port number to use to communicate with the upstream WSUS server.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the name of a WSUS server.
Specifies the port number to use to communicate with the upstream WSUS server.
Specifies that the WSUS server should use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) via HTTPS to communicate with an upstream server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the local server
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer Name : contoso

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the IUpdateServer object for the local computer.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a remote server
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer -Name "contoso" -PortNumber 8530 Name : contoso

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the IUpdateServer object for a remote computer.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the WSUS update object with details about the update.

The Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet gets the Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) update object with details about the update. This cmdlet requires the update unique identifier (GUID) or a set of filter criteria such as classification, approval and status as parameter.

The Get-WsusUpdate cmdlet can be called in two ways:
-- Passing in the Update ID (GUID) and RevisionNumber. This cmdlet returns a single update matching the specified Update ID and revision number. -- Passing in filter parameters. These parameters include Classification, Approval, and Status. One or more updates matching the specified criteria are returned.

Specifies the approved state of the one or more updates to be returned. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Unapproved -- Declined -- Approved -- AnyExceptDeclined

Specifies the classification of updates for which you want to get updates. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- All -- Critical -- Security -- WSUS

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the installation status for which to search. An update will be included only if it has at least one computer with the specified status. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Needed -- FailedOrNeeded -- InstalledNotApplicableOrNoStatus -- Failed -- InstalledNotApplicable -- NoStatus -- Any
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the revision number of a specific revision of an update. To specify the latest revision, set to zero.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies the update by its GUID. The GUID uniquely identifies the Group Policy Object (GPO).

Specifies the approved state of the one or more updates to be returned. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Unapproved -- Declined -- Approved -- AnyExceptDeclined

Specifies the classification of updates for which you want to get updates. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- All -- Critical -- Security -- WSUS

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the revision number of a specific revision of an update. To specify the latest revision, set to zero.

Specifies the installation status for which to search. An update will be included only if it has at least one computer with the specified status. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Needed -- FailedOrNeeded -- InstalledNotApplicableOrNoStatus -- Failed -- InstalledNotApplicable -- NoStatus -- Any
Specifies the update by its GUID. The GUID uniquely identifies the Group Policy Object (GPO).
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get updates by status
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusUpdate -Classification All -Approval Unapproved -Status FailedOrNeeded

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all unapproved updates with a status of failed or needed.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get critical unapproved updates
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusUpdate -Classification Critical -Approval Unapproved -Status Any Title Classification Installed/Not Applicable Approved Percentage ----- -------------- ----------------------------- -------- Windows XP Update Package, Critical Updates NotApproved October 25, 2001

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all critical unapproved updates.

maml:description.maml:para: Performs the process of cleanup on a WSUS server.

The Invoke-WsusServerCleanup cmdlet performs the process of cleanup on a specified Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server. This process has the same impact as running the Cleanup Wizard from within the WSUS Console application and allows the specification of the same options as parameters.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes obsolete computers from the database.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes obsolete updates from the database.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes unneeded update files.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes obsolete revisions to updates from the database.
Specifies that the cmdlet declines expired updates.
Specifies that the cmdlet declines superseded updates.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes obsolete computers from the database.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes obsolete updates from the database.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes unneeded update files.
Specifies that the cmdlet deletes obsolete revisions to updates from the database.
Specifies that the cmdlet declines expired updates.
Specifies that the cmdlet declines superseded updates.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Run cleanup for obsolete computers
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer | Invoke-WsusServerCleanup -CleanupObsoleteComputers Obsolete Computers Deleted: 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command runs this cmdlet on the local WSUS server specifying the option to clean up obsolete computers.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Run cleanup for obsolete computers and updates
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer consoso | Invoke-WsusServerCleanup -CleanupObsoleteComputers -CleanupObsoleteUpdates Obsolete Updates Deleted: 62 Obsolete Computers Deleted: 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command runs this cmdlet on the server named contoso specifying the options to clean up obsolete computers and obsolete updates.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a dynamic category from a WSUS server.
The Remove-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet removes a dynamic category from a Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet removes a dynamic category from the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet removes dynamic categories from the local server.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category to remove. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to remove.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet removes a dynamic category from the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet removes dynamic categories from the local server.
Specifies a dynamic category object. This cmdlet removes the dynamic category that this parameter specifies. To obtain a dynamic category, use the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category to remove. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies a dynamic category object. This cmdlet removes the dynamic category that this parameter specifies. To obtain a dynamic category, use the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to remove.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet removes a dynamic category from the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet removes dynamic categories from the local server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a dynamic category
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-WsusDynamicCategory -DynamicCategoryType Device -Name "PCI/Device07"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a dynamic category named PCI/Device07 of the Device type from the local update server.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets whether the classifications of updates that WSUS synchronizes are enabled.
The Set-WsusClassification cmdlet enables or disables the category of updates, for example, security or critical, to be synchronized.
To use this cmdlet without filtering results, the Get-WsusClassification cmdlet must be run, then the results are passed it into this cmdlet.
To use this cmdlet with filtered results, the Get-WsusClassification cmdlet must be run, then results are filtered using the Where-Object cmdlet and passed into this cmdlet.
Specifies that updates are not to be synchronized for the specified classification.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the classification of updates that are to be synchronized. If the Disable parameter is used, then this parameter specifies the classification of updates that are not to be synchronized. This parameter value is passed from the Get-WsusClassification cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies the classification of updates that are to be synchronized. If the Disable parameter is used, then this parameter specifies the classification of updates that are not to be synchronized. This parameter value is passed from the Get-WsusClassification cmdlet.
Specifies that updates are not to be synchronized for the specified classification.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Disable driver updates
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusClassification | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.Classification.Title -Eq "Drivers"} | Set-WsusClassification -Disable

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies that you do not want driver updates.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the synchronization status of a dynamic category.
The Set-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet sets the synchronization status of a dynamic category in a specified Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet modifies a dynamic category on the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet modifies dynamic categories on the local server.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category that this cmdlet modifies. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to modify.

Specifies the update synchronization status for the dynamic category. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Blocked. No updates are being synchronized for this dynamic category. -- SyncUpdates. Updates are being synchronized for this dynamic category.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the update synchronization status for the dynamic category. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Blocked. No updates are being synchronized for this dynamic category. -- SyncUpdates. Updates are being synchronized for this dynamic category.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet modifies a dynamic category on the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet modifies dynamic categories on the local server.

Specifies a dynamic category object. This cmdlet modifies the synchronization settings for the dynamic category that this parameter specifies. To obtain a dynamic category, use the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet.

Specifies the type of the dynamic category that this cmdlet modifies. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- ComputerModel -- Device -- Application

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies a dynamic category object. This cmdlet modifies the synchronization settings for the dynamic category that this parameter specifies. To obtain a dynamic category, use the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the dynamic category to modify.

Specifies the update synchronization status for the dynamic category. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Blocked. No updates are being synchronized for this dynamic category. -- SyncUpdates. Updates are being synchronized for this dynamic category.

Specifies a WSUS server. This cmdlet modifies a dynamic category on the server that this parameter specifies. To obtain a server, use the Get-WsusServer cmdlet. If you do not specify a value for this parameter, the cmdlet modifies dynamic categories on the local server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the synchronization status of a dynamic category
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-WsusDynamicCategory -DynamicCategoryType Device -Name "PCI/Device07" | Set-WsusDynamicCategory -Status Blocked

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a dynamic category from the local server by using the Get-WsusDynamicCategory cmdlet. The command passes the dynamic category to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. The current cmdlet sets the synchronization status to Blocked. This value means that no updates are synchronized for this dynamic category.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets whether the product representing the category of updates to synchronize is enabled.

The Set-WsusProduct cmdlet enables or disables the product representing the category of updates to synchronize. In order to use this cmdlet, the Get-WsusProduct cmdlet must be run with its results passed into this cmdlet. You can run the Where-Object cmdlet to filter results.
Specifies that updates are not to be synchronized for the specified product.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the product for which the updates are to be synchronized. If the Disable parameter is used, then this parameter specifies the product for which the updates are not to be synchronized. This parameter value is passed from the Get-WsusProduct cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies that updates are not to be synchronized for the specified product.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.

Specifies the product for which the updates are to be synchronized. If the Disable parameter is used, then this parameter specifies the product for which the updates are not to be synchronized. This parameter value is passed from the Get-WsusProduct cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Specify updates for a product
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WsusServer | Get-WsusProduct | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.product.title -Eq "Antigen"} | Set-WsusProduct

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies that you want updates for the Antigen product.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets whether the WSUS server synchronizes from Microsoft Update or an upstream server.

The Set-WsusServerSynchronization cmdlet sets whether the Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server synchronizes from Microsoft Update or an upstream server. This cmdlet allows you to specify settings such as the upstream server name, the port number, and whether or not to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL).

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies that the WSUS server synchronizes updates from Microsoft Update.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the port number to use to communicate with the upstream WSUS server.
Specifies whether the WSUS server is a replica server.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies that the WSUS server should use SSL via HTTPS to communicate with an upstream server.
Specifies the name of a local server from which to synchronize updates.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Continue -- Ignore -- Inquire -- SilentlyContinue -- Stop -- Suspend
Specifies an information variable.
Specifies the port number to use to communicate with the upstream WSUS server.
Specifies whether the WSUS server is a replica server.
Specifies that the WSUS server synchronizes updates from Microsoft Update.
Specifies the object that contains the WSUS server. This value is obtained by calling the Get-WsusServer cmdlet and passing the resulting IUpdateServer object into this cmdlet.
Specifies that the WSUS server should use SSL via HTTPS to communicate with an upstream server.
Specifies the name of a local server from which to synchronize updates.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Synchonize from a specified server
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-WsusServerSynchronization -UssServerName "Test" -PortNumber 42 -UseSSL

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies that the local WSUS Server is to synchronize from another server named Test using port number 42 and the SSL protocol.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Synchronize from Microsoft Update
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-WsusServerSynchronization -SyncFromMU The Update Server was successfully configured with the following parameters: Synchronize from Microsoft Update

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies that the local WSUS Server is to synchronize from Microsoft Update.
